content.raw: To me the `math::equal` routine looks ill-conceived because it is ambiguous but looks like you could know what it would do. Certainly using an absolute tolerance is not the behavior I would have expected -- that is almost never right! It should have a fuzzier name like `math::relativelyEqual` or my favorite `numericallyEqual`. That way people would worry about what the method actually does and look it up. In any case looking up `math::equal` doesn't tell you anything because the current documentation is also ambiguous (just says "to a tolerance").
